Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, a fundamental right in a Western democracy.
The government is imposing censorship on those with differing opinions.
The draft bill exempts the government and mainstream media from the misinformation rules, indicating bias.
Main Themes: Bias and exemption for government and media
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech, or freedom of expression is the most fundamental right in a Western democracy like Australia.
The government deserves to be severely punished at the next election for trying to undermine the basic civil liberties of the populace.
